item.title: Ink-Stained Pixels
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: From a historic perspective, one of the most intriguing things about technology is the way that so-called “category killers” often make us forget about what came before. There are all sorts of examples of this, including the one I wrote about just the other night. The iPad, case in point, somehow made everyone forget about decades of formative digital tablets in one fell swoop. Another example is the Amazon Kindle, a decade-old device that successfully created a formative industry around electronic books.
